item.title: Rilke
item.description: I am to alone in the world, and not alone enough to make every moment holy I am too tiny in this world, and not tiny enough just to lie before you like a thing, shrewd and secretive I want my own will, and I want simply to be with my will, as it goes toward action, and in the silent, sometimes hardly moving times when something is coming near

item.title: Seduction
item.description: Charismatic what is it? has little to do with an exciting physical appearance of colorful personality: qualities that elicit short-term interst. clear vision, a quality of single-mindedness, and practical skills can be devastatingly charsmatic, provided it is matched with some success. it is an illusion in they eyes of those who see you as having what they lack. this is the guru effect. the aura you are after is not the fiery one of most charismatics.

item.title: Addiction
item.description: What am I addicted to Hearthstone: Game Tiktok: social media Pornhub: porn feeling insecure

item.title: Snowbanks
item.description: Those great sweeps ofsnow that stop suddenly six feet from the house . . . Thoughts that go so far. The boy gets out ofhigh school and reads no more books; The son stops calling home. The mother puts down her rolling pin and makes no more bread. And the wife looks at her husband one night at a party) and loves him no more. The energy leaves the wine) and the minister falls leaving the church.

item.title: Be a Man
item.description: What does it mean when a man falls in love with aradient face across the room? Instead of pursuing the woman and trying to get her alone, away from her husband, he needs to go alone himself, perhaps to a mountain cabin, for three months, write poetry, canoe down a river, and dream.

item.title: Prefrontal Training
item.description: Dos Donts get drunk: alcohol interferes with the ability of prefrontal cortex neurons to communicate with one another, by disrupting dopamine receptors and blocking a particular kind of neuron called an NMDA receptor. heavy drinkers also experience the frontal lobe system souble whammy: they lose certain capabilties, such as impulse control or motor coordination or the ability to drive safely, but they arent aware that theyve lost them. overgrowth of dopaminergic neurons in the frontal lobes leads to autism, which mimics fontal lobe damage to some degree.

item.title: Organized Mind
item.description: our brains are evolved to focus on one thing at a time attention is a limited-capacity resource. something can grab your attention automatically, usually something salient to your survival, with evolutionary origins. if we have a filter for attention overload as a serious problem we’re expected to do shadow work - the work of the companies for them. have you ever sat in an airplan or train, just staring out the window with nothing to read, looking at nothing in particular?

item.title: Happiness
item.description: most of us are conditioned to devalue happiness right from childhood. we should try to not get distracted from making happiness-enhancing decisions 7 sins, 7 good habits prioritizing, but not pursuing, happiness chasing superiority as children, we are exposed to feedback that tells us whether we are superior or inferior to others around us. consider the impact of failing to acquire a girlfriend or boyfriend when everyone else has one.

item.title: Unscripted
item.description: there are two time types i can manipulate: freee time and indentured time. free time is the time I own. and it’s the only time that’s important. NOBODY has a cliam on it. I do what I want: sleep in, write, read, whatever warms my heart. Follow SCRIPTED protocol and ypu’re locked into a shitty deal where free time is automatically presumed to exist only on the weekends indentured time is time soneone else owns: school, studying, work, traffic, my biz.

item.title: Getting Love
item.description: we all started out life whole and vital. To one degree or another, we were all wounded by our caretakers' intrusiveness or neglect. We experienced a primitive anxiety: the world is not a safe place. When we are adults, capable of keeping ourselves fed and warm and dry. When our partners are hostile or unhelpful, a silent alarm is triggered deep in our brains that fills us with the fear of death.

item.title: Tidy
item.description: discarding all at once intensely and completely tidy in the right order do not even think of putting things away until i have finished the process of discarding visualize my destination imagine what it would be like to live in a clutter free space visualization aid: look at interior decorating magazines the fuck this is pseudodeep why i want to design my home that way. after a few rounds of recursive quasi-scientific soul searching im supposed to find out that the point of doing this is to be happy selection criterion: joy we should be choosing what we want to keep, not what we want to get rid of take each item in one’s hand and ask if this spark joy.

item.title: Relationship Cure
item.description: in relationships, if both parties are willing to hang in there, pay attention, and change direction when we make mistakes, we can improve the relationship. step one: look at my bids what makes marriages succeed or fail? self-disclosure: a person’s willingness to reveal his or her most guarded, personal thoughts and experiences to another person. ‘after collecting and viewing hundereds of hours of videotape, i found very few examples of self-disclosure.

item.title: Digital Minimalism
item.description: Principles of digital minimalism clutter is costly optimization is important Thoreau economics The cost of a thing is the amount of life required to be exchanged for it immediately or in the long run. radical rethinking of the consumerist culture. who could justify trading a lifetime of stress and backbreaking labor for better ‘stuff’ Thoreau’s new economics was devaloped in an industrial age, but his insigts apply to our life.

item.title: Minigoal

item.title: Self Esteem
item.description: If you lack the courage to live the life you really wnt, you’re going to be chronically disappointed in yourself keep my promises to myself people with low self-esteem are very good at keeping their promises to other people and very bad at keeping promises to themselves choose good career path because society admires choose to marry someone because they know their family would approve true self-esteem comes from balancing the wants and needs of others with the wants and needs of myself i need a solid founation of keeping promises to myself spend more time with people i genuiunely like i am the average of the five people i spend the most time with

item.title: Muscle
item.description: i can build muscle in a calorie deficit build muscle: water protein: 1g of protein per pound of weight energy: 3500 cal/lb of fat training stimulus: training tips warm up with light cardio. should be sweating a little bit before starting. train the hardest exercises first squats compounds first then isolation time your set time under tension is more important:40 seconds for hypertrophy work rest ratio 3:1 or 5:1.

item.title: Road Less Traveled
item.description: we all have maps. a comprehensive understanding of the world. transference is the problem of using our simplistic childhood’s map to navigate the world. we fail to recognize. most people opt for a life of very limited honesty and openness and relative closedness, hiding themselves and their maps from the world. the rewards of the difficult life of honesty and dedication to the truth commensurate the demands. by exposing my map to other people, i can be challenged and grow as a person.

item.title: Principles
item.description: dont confuse goals with desires most problems are potential improvements list my problems. if i cant identify my problems thats because either i lack the skill or lack the will :) the problems are harsh reality, very painful to look at. so i cope my subconsciously put them out of sight to make them out of mind i defintely worry about appearing to not have problems than about not achieving my desired results.

item.title: Data Mining Algorithm
item.description: The score functionused to measure the quality of different tree structures is a general miscalassification loss function, defined as $\sum_{i=1}^nC(y(i),\hat{y}(i))$ $C(y(i),\hat{y}(i))$ is the loss incurred when the class label for the ith data vector, y(i) is predicted by the tree to be $\hat{y}(i)\ne y(i)$ cross-validation partitions the training data into a subset for building the tree then estimates the misclassifcation rate on the remaining validation subset. this partitioning is repeated multiple times on different subsets and the misclassfication rates are then averaged to yield a cross-validation estimate of how well a tree of a particular size will perform on new, unseen data.

item.title: Top Command
item.description: Linux memory types There are three types of memory, and one is optional. physical memory, a limited resource where code and data must reside when executed or referenced. optional swap file: where modified (dirty) memory can be saved and later retrieved if too many demands are made on physical memory big boy virtual memory: unlimited resource intended to abstraction: free from physical memory addresses/limits isolation: every process in a separate address space sharing: single mapping can serve multiple needs flexibility: assign a virtual address to a file

item.title: Principles of Data Mining
item.description: Chapter 1 Introduction is an interdisciplinary exercise, can be thought of as statistics, database, or machine learning problem. from observational datasets to find unsuspected relations and to summarize the data in novel ways deals with data that have already been collected for some purpose other than the data mining analysis. This is different from statistics, which data are often colleted by using efficient strategies to answer specific answers. Models and Patterns Include linear equations, rules, clusters, graphs, tree structures, and recurrent patterns in time series.

item.title: Core
item.description: Mình là một người eccentric, và mình biết điều đó. Tính cách đó chỉ thường mang lại cho mình bao nhiều điều phiền toái. Mình khinh thường mình và sự căm ghét những thứ giới hạn bản thân mình vào một khuôn khổ. Khuôn khổ rõ ràng là một từ trung tính, chắc chắn không ai tệ hơn khi bị người khác bỏ vào khuôn khổ. Họ sẽ chỉ cảm thấy tồi tệ hơn thôi.

item.title: Class War
item.description: Excerpts from American Affairs' The Real Class War. Note that this post is literally me taking notes (more like copying verbatim) of what the author wrote and I have absolutely no rights to the material provided. Don’t @ me. The working class has experienced economic stagnation and precarity, and even life expectancy in the US, as well as ower family stability and civic engagement. Social mobility has declined, while inequality has widened.

item.title: On the nature of Death
item.description: You, even while you still have life and light, are as good as dead: you squander the greater part of your time in sleep; you snore when awake; you never stop daydreaming; you are burdened with a mind disturbed by grundless fear; and often you cannot discover what is wrong with you, when, like some drunken wretch, you are buffeted with countless cares on every side and drift along aimlessly in utter bewilderement of mind.

item.title: Boredom
item.description: This blog is written for my Gen Z/millenial friends out there. Imagine a typical school day. You wake up, turn off the alarm. The next thing you do, instinctively, is to check your social media. After all, man’s search for happiness might just be man’s search for stimuli. “A certain amount of boredom is essential to a happy life.” Kant’s notion of the sublime - our own insignificance in the universe around us.

item.title: What I feel
item.description: It’s meta, but I feel like no matter I do, I won’t be able to feel like how I want to feel. Not that I have achieved a lot and feel empty afterwards. Full disclaimer, I have not achieved a single thing that I wanted to do this year. It’s sad and pathetic but it’s also enlightening, I guess. It’s enlightening in a way that most people I’ve met feel this way.

item.title: Limbic Manipulation
item.description: I can’t speak for other countries, but Vietnamese youth have been growing up bombarded with anti-

item.title: on Lee Kuan Yew
item.description: I found myself thinking about what Lee Kuan Yew had to say about many things a lot recently. While I know close to nothing about him, I can imagine that most of his thoughts and actions stemmed from a systemic and practical approach. I remember reading him stating that while he takes a certain liking to some ideas, he is only interested in what works in real life. This Machiavellian approach to problems reminds me of one of Charlie Munger’s lessons in life: avoid extremely intense ideology.

item.title: Ah Here We Go Again
item.description: Hello world. Hi, I’m going to try to blog again. From my experience from past attempts, I can’t keep up with writing essays if I only treat it as a ‘feels good’ activity when I procrastinate. Now that I know better, I will actually put self-imposed deadlines to churn out content for this blog. Who knows what to make of this decision. I’m in part hopeful that I will try to do my research and write interesting articles.
